response_parsed.title: Observing Edge Runtimes Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to leverage FastAPI and Python 3.12+'s new edge functions to monitor runtime performance of your applications in serverless environments.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs using Python.
Python 3.12 introduces edge functions for serverless computing, enabling efficient and scalable deployment of microservices.
Combining FastAPI with edge functions allows you to monitor the runtime performance of your API endpoints in serverless environments.
This approach provides improved resource utilization, lower costs, and increased reliability.
By observing edge runtimes, developers can optimize their code for better performance and user experience.

code_examples.code:
import uvicorn
uvicorn.run('main:app', host='0.0.0.0', port=8000, log_level='info', access_log=False, workers=2)

version_notes.note: Introduces edge functions for serverless computing.
Enables building FastAPI applications that can be deployed as edge functions.

caveats: Edge functions have certain limitations compared to traditional serverless offerings, such as restricted access to network resources and limited execution time.
It's crucial to test your FastAPI application thoroughly before deploying it as an edge function.
Ensure you understand the specific requirements of the serverless platform you choose for deployment.
